instructions: Analyze each video segment for the following emotions and report them in the emotions field. Be specific about the emotions detected, noting intensity levels and context where possible. Only include emotions that are clearly present in the segment.

emotions.name: Joy
emotions.description: Expressions of happiness, delight, elation, or pleasure. Look for smiles, laughter, and celebrating.

emotions.name: Sadness
emotions.description: Expressions of unhappiness, disappointment, or grief. Look for frowns, tears, or slumped posture.

emotions.name: Anger
emotions.description: Expressions of frustration, rage, or irritation. Look for furrowed brows, clenched fists, or aggressive gestures.

emotions.name: Fear
emotions.description: Expressions of anxiety, worry, or terror. Look for wide eyes, trembling, or defensive postures.

emotions.name: Surprise
emotions.description: Expressions of astonishment or shock. Look for raised eyebrows, open mouths, or sudden reactions.

emotions.name: Disgust
emotions.description: Expressions of revulsion or distaste. Look for wrinkled noses, turned down mouths, or recoiling movements.

emotions.name: Contempt
emotions.description: Expressions of disdain, scorn, or superiority. Look for one-sided smirks or dismissive gestures.

emotions.name: Confusion
emotions.description: Expressions of bewilderment or uncertainty. Look for furrowed brows, head tilting, or hesitant movements.

emotions.name: Excitement
emotions.description: Expressions of enthusiasm or eagerness. Look for animated gestures, wide eyes, or energetic movements.

emotions.name: Determination
emotions.description: Expressions of resolve or focus. Look for intense concentration, set jaws, or purposeful movements.
